Package com.stuypulse.stuylib.pid

Class PIDController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stuypulse.stuylib.pid.PIDController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IStream
    public class PIDController
extends java.lang.Object
implements IStream
    This is a PID Controller that works as an IStream. The PIDController takes in the error stream as an IStream, and then using the get() command, is able to give you your result back. It is able to get the polling rate automatically, but it is recommended that you call it at a constant rate. It works as an IStream so that if you have any functions that need to take in an IStream, ie motor controller, than you can use this.

      • PIDController

        public PIDController​(IStream errorStream,
                     double p,
                     double i,
                     double d)
        Initialize a PIDController using an error stream and the PID multipliers.
        Parameters:
        errorStream - An IStream that provides the error to the PID Controller
        p - The Proportional Multiplier
        i - The Integral Multiplier
        d - The Derivative Multiplier

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the PIDController. This should be used if there is a large gap in time between a get call. The controller automatically calls this if it detects a gap greater than 1.0 second.

      • get

        public double get​(double error)
        Calculate the value that the PIDController wants to move at.
        Parameters:
        error - the error that the controller will use
        Returns:
        the calculated result from the PIDController

      • get

        public double get()
        Calculate the value that the PIDController wants to move at. This is the same as using get(error), but it defaults to the mErrorStream. If no error stream is provided, then it throws a runtime error.
        Specified by:
        get in interface IStream
        Returns:
        The calculated value for the PIDController

      • getError

        public double getError()
        Gets the last error from the error stream. Updates with get() command.
        Returns:
        The last error from the error stream.
